body: Order the following 3 minerals in order of increasing hardness. I. Graphite; II. Orthoclase; III. Corundum
Order the following four moons in terms of increasing mass. I. Ganymede; II. Deimos; III. Earth's Moon; IV. Enceladus
During which phase of meiosis does crossing- over occur?
Male stickleback fish will not attack fish without red stripes, but will attack unrealistic fish models with red stripes. This is an example of what type of behavior?
A certain reaction has a rate constant with units 1 over molar seconds. The order of the reaction is
Free rotation about single bonds is characteristic of what VSEPR hybridization?
If his coworkers speak at a rate of 200 words per minute and he only pays attention $20\$ of the time, what fractional proportion of the words of his coworker does he hear?
What is the angle formed between the minute and hour hand at the time 10:30?
How many ways can 3 couples fill 6 seats at a movie theater if each couple must sit together?
Identify all of the following moons that orbit a planet lying past the solar system's frost line? I. Triton; II. Phobos; III. Io
Which of the following best describes the Gulf Stream current that runs along the US east coast?
What term describes the failure of one or more pairs of homologous chromosomes or sister chromatids to separate during cell division?
Chordata and Echinodermata fall into what clade, characterized by the formation of the mouth secondary to the anus?
Which of the following reactions is a double- replacement reaction?
How many unpaired electrons are in a neutral fluorine atom?
In square centimeters, what is the surface area of a cylinder of radius 5 cm and height 10 cm in terms of pi?
What is the sum of the first 3 terms in a geometric sequence with 4th term 64 and 5th term 32?
What geological feature is formed at a convergent boundary between two tectonic plates when one plate is forced beneath the other?
A binary star system has one star with mass 4 solar masses and semi- major axis 3 AU. The other star has a mass of 6 solar masses. What is its semi- major axis?
What term describes a body cavity formed from the mesoderm?
Identify all of the following three phyla that contain true tissues: I - Porifera, II - Cnidaria, III - Platyhelminthes
Thorium- 228 atoms naturally undergo alpha decay to produce radium- 224. Given that the atomic number of radium is 88, how many neutrons are in a radium- 224 nucleus?

Brennan dissolves 3 moles of sodium chloride into 1 liter of water. If water's freezing point depression constant is approximately 2, by how many degrees Celsius does the water's freezing point decrease?
If theta is an angle in the 2nd quadrant and cos of theta is - 3/5, what is the value of sin of theta?
An unfair coin is 5 times more likely to land on heads than it is on tails. What is the probability that Brennan flips said coin 4 times and gets tails every time?
Compared to the Sun, a star has half the radius and twice the surface temperature. How many times greater is its luminosity?
Which of the following gasses is considered the strongest greenhouse gas?
Which of the following phyla has the most species?
After which of the following scenarios would you expect primary succession to occur?

choices.W: A flood in a grassland area
choices.Y: A fire burns through a forest
choices.Z: A hurricane blows through a marshland area

body: Brennan has 7 foil balls for his cats, stuck under one of his three bookshelves. By how many microstates can this macrostate be realized?
After Brennan tries and fails to retrieve his foil balls, all 7 are still stuck under the same bookshelf. What is the entropy of this macrostate?
Which two of the following three equations never intersect? I. $2y = 4x + 7$; II. $4y - 14 = 16x$; III. $y = 4x + 14$
What is the square root of the expression $11 - 4\qrt{7}$ in the form $a + b \qrt{7}$?
What name is given to obducted chunks of oceanic crust, which are often found near current or former subduction zones?
What is the name describing bodies who cross planetary orbits between Jupiter and Neptune?
The cortical reaction is triggered by the release of what positively charged, divalent ion into the cytosol?

Ident all of the following three statements which are true of C4 plants: I - PEP Carboxylase reduces photorespiration, II - There is temporal separation of carbon fixation and the Calvin cycle, III - Calvin cycle occurs in bundle- sheath cells
At 1 atmosphere, what must the temperature be for the enthalpy of formation of molecular oxygen (O2) to be zero Joules?

Heat is transferred to a system containing 1 mol of an ideal gas such that its temperature rises by $20\athrm{K}$ and the volume increases by $2\athrm{L}$. In Joules, what is the net change in energy to the system, $\elta \athrm{U}$? Assume the constant of molar heat capacity under constant volume, $\athrm{C_v}$, to be 12.5 (J/mol K).
Variance is proportional to the population standard deviation raised to what power?
If the point (5, 2) is reflected across the line $\athrm{x} = - 12$, then across the line $\athrm{y} = \athrm{x}$, what are the final coordinates of the point?
Using luminosity decline rate, the Phillips Relation allows astronomers to use what type of supernovae as a standard candle?
What name is given to intrusive igneous rocks that form close to the surface and appear more like extrusive rocks than plutonic rocks?
A pineapple is an example of what type of fruit?
Which of the following parts of the adult brain originates from the embryonic forebrain in humans?
The acid- or base- catalyzed tautomerization of an enol results in a molecule with what functional group?
A molecule of toluene (C7H8) contains how many chemically distinct carbon molecules?
In terms of pi and in centimeters squared, what is the lateral surface area of a cone with radius 5 cm and height 12 cm?

Brennan the penguin sits at the origin of a coordinate grid. Every minute, Brennan waddles one unit north, south, east, or west, choosing between them at random. What is the probability that Brennan is back at the origin 4 waddles later?
According to the island equilibrium model, which of the following islands would have the greatest amount of species diversity?

choices.W: Small island, close to the mainland
choices.X: Small island, far from the mainland
choices.Y: Large island, close to the mainland
choices.Z: Large island, far from the mainland

body: Brennan has a rare disorder in which his pancreas is no longer able to produce enzymes. Identify all of the four following macromolecules which would have impaired digestion: I - Carbohydrates, II - Proteins, III - Nucleic Acids, IV - Fats
